alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:24AM EST until December 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... Brandywine Creek At Wilmington affecting New Castle County. For the Brandywine Creek...including Wilmington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Brandywine Creek at Wilmington. * WHEN...From this afternoon to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Minor flooding begins along the creek in the Brandywine State Park. At 16.5 feet, North Park Drive, west of North Market Street, in Brandywine State Park is subject to flooding and closures. At 17.0 feet, Some flooding begins in the historic Breck`s Mill area in Montchanin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.4 feet on 04/16/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Brandywine Creek Wilmington 16.5 15.7 Mon 6 am 14.5 13.1 16.5 1pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM EST.
